comment: The very first plugin I'm unable to use in 10 years of jetbrains ecosystem: the login is ficky, unusable in remote environment, completion window is a mess, both in terms of UX and lack of proposed content. Microsoft efforts in providing a plugin for a concurrent IDE of theirs is a joke.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The tool give mixed feelings. It is helpful. but also really poor. On many occasions it doen's follow the intsructions. It imagines code and files and provides comments about things that do not exist. Which is a waste of time and credits.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Rider.

Adding API key for OpenAI and using GPT5.2* yields an error:

Sorry, an error occurred while generating a response. Details: unhandled status from server: 400 { "error": { "message": "Unsupported value: 'temperature' does not support 0 with this model. Only the default (1) value is supported.", "type": "invalid_request_error", "param": "temperature", "c... Read more from logs. Request ID:********

  • including mini and nano

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: There have been far too many bugs over the past six months. Are you also using AI to write your code?

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Since upgrading to version 1.5.63-243, memory usage grows until it consumes all 32 GB plus swap and pegs the CPU (Core i7, 12 cores). If I’m not fast enough to kill copilot-language-server, the whole OS freezes and I have to hard power off the laptop.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Useful only for stupidly simple tasks, like generating some comments maybe extrapolation of arrays where this plugin can guess the next possible values (which it is also terrible at, BTW).

When it comes to generating code, it's good only for disposable scripts where you don't care about the code quality and just want to get to the results faster. So expect surprises and some weird, repetitive, and inefficient solutions.

Very often, fighting with the plugin to get what you need turns takes 10x more time than writing it yourself.

It doesn't understand the context, it generates complete b*shit out of nowhere, and of course, it always "knows" what you need by suggesting a complete nonsense. The lags are also horrible. You expect it to generate code for you when you need it -> it does nothing. You poke it, poke again -> nothing. Then, when you don't need it, it generates and autocompletes your code with some totally illogical crap that you have to delete.

Super annoying!

And I honestly have a feeling it was better when it first came out than it is today.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: it sucks

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Not usable

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
It's improved, but not perfect. The text in the prompt input field is single-line, meaning you can't select a line by pressing CMD + A; the entire area is selected. This didn't happen in earlier versions, and it doesn't exist in VS Code. Files referenced by the AI ​​can't be opened by clicking on them; an error occurs.

Can you tell me if I launch "Plan" mode, do subagents launch? Because there's no indication of this anywhere during agent execution (unlike in VS Code).

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Completely useless... Every time I try to use this plugin, it crashes and displays a warning message. Close the IDE, restart it, and you can use the plugin. After half an hour? It crashes again. Updates almost every day and still the same errors. Amazing for a paid service.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Now, it's way better

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Only after migrating to VS Code's plugin I've realized how far behind Pycharm's is - poor performance, "unknown" errors, poor UI, and unusable when working with WSL. Until this plugin is fixed from the bottom, I can't see myself ever use it again.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Not usable... I prefer the UI of PyCharm, but this plugin has so many bugs: Agent mode fails to scan files, write scripts... it's impossible to have an agent running snippets on the command line.

Basically, this is a differentiator in favour of VSCode. I find myself editing code on VSCode with GitHub Copilot and then using the interface of PyCharm. It is not sustainable... Either JetBrains steps into this, or eventually they are going to loose the customers because of this plugin being so faulty.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: "So disgustingly good that it made me abandon my precious GoLand subscription and crawl back to VS Code like a humble peasant. Thanks for saving me money, I guess."

comment: Playing a blinder.

comment: Keine Ahnung was gemacht wird, aber das Plugin ist schlimm. Restore/Discard geht nicht, der Copilot zerschisst regelmässig die Files, er vergisst schon nach einer Zeile den Context. Es sieht zwar ähnlich aus, wie der Copilot von VSCode, es ist aber so vollkommen unbrauchbar.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Very bad user experience in comparison to VS Code Copilot - problems with fluent switching between edit/ask/agent, changes model when switching mode, bad diff integration, etc. Good direction, but still a lot of work ahead - mainly in UX.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I use GitHub Copilot more than any other, because of the low cost.

It is an absolutely horrid bit of software. Normally it swallows the first prompt you send after it initializes, so if you forget that, and write the prompt in the text entry box without copying it from somwehere else you can lose a ton of effort and time. And it will re-initialize after some time of not being used even if the IDE itself has remained open, so it can seem quite random when it swallows prompts.

It frequently hangs, saying that it is working, but seems to be stuck, on prompts that are not complicated enough to warrant a very long lapse.

It frequently loses track of itself. The output stream of token responses will continue flowing even though the "play" / "stop" button has become disconnected from it, meaning that there is no way to stop the process, except to send a new process, or to close the IDE and start over.

It doesn't know how to use its own tools very well. It will frequently cat files in the project instead of using it's own read_file tool.

This is compounded by the fact that the AI Chat windows quickly loses the ability to see terminal output, but even though I explain this, and tell it to redirect output to file and read it with read_file, it will never remember this instruction for long, even when I attach it in COPILOT_INSTRUCTIONS.md.

It has no understanding of lint rules, and is generally terrible at following existing patterns in a codebase. If the goal is to understand the whole codebase it fails completely.

Everytime it needs to open a new terminal, which is at least once per session, the first command is swallowed by the terminal (running Bazzite, and direnv, which both have shell init stuff that runs. Copiloyt is unable to comprehend, or remember, this limitation, and frequently gets lost trying to figure this out.

It is VERY poorly integrated with the IDE.

Everytime it changes a file the file is opened, made active, and the cursor hijacks typing into the file that Copilot is editing. This freqeuntly results in human typing being interleaved with AI edits, or otherwise mangling, deleting, moving, AI edits, depending on what keys I am hitting as it is hijacking the focus.

This is bar none the worst user experience of any tool I have ever used.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I like it, but the thing I dislike the most is the text editor they're using.

That's my biggest pain point atm.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Works as expected. For JVM projects this is perfect, you get the versatility of IntelliJ and the integration of a smart ai with automatic context collection. I'm not really sure why this plugin has so many 1 star reviews, perhaps previous versions? i've been using it for 1 month now daily (end of 2025) and its perfect.

comment: The user experience is still very rough. Screen constantly shakes around while the LLM is replying, then dumps me at the bottom, and I have to scroll to the top. Lots of unnecessary spam in the output, with delays while various "tools" are run. It's making my head hurt. It also immediately crashed on upgrade.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: unwork for old version, useless

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Idea is nice, but it's not reliable at all for me.

Agent: Absolutely daft. All of its tools time out (digging though the library folder in a Unity project often), and thus the agent struggles to do anything useful. Autocomplete: Fast, but decidedly worse than Augment Code. Context: Very limited, there's no broad indexing, it can only fetch files. MCP: Limited, it struggles to connect to many MCP servers I would use, such as Rider's built-in MCP, that would allow me to equip the agent with tools that actually work. :\

The quick chat features are where Copilot seems to shine, but that's where every AI tool shines...

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
the worts extention ever

  1. stops working with every extention update
  2. can't even login to github copilot sometimes due to corporate proxy
  3. sometimes this extention just stops working, completely disrupting my flow
  4. often times, the changes that the copilot wants to make to already exiting files fail with no further explanation of why

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
copilot-language-server using up 900MB of RAM is absolutely insane for one IDE plugin that i barely even use.

Also the functionality is way worse than VSCode copilot.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Finally this latest build seems to work OK and it's my go to way of doing things now. Any idea how long it will take to get the new Gemini flash 3.0 as a model? And for those who complain that it doesn't necessarily work the way you want it to that's why you have MCPS that you can install that helps keep the AI honest. At a bare minimum you should be using Serena MCP and shrimp task manager MCP.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: By now the GitHub Copilot plugin even causes IDE freezes. The quality has simply become so abysmal that I keep projects open in Rider and Visual Studio Code, and I only use VS Code to make changes via Agent Mode because it works cleanly and bug-free there. Only GitHub Copilot's inline autocompletion is still usable — otherwise it's a useless plugin for me.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I switched from Junie and AI Assistant to GitHub copilot and I could not be more pleased. The UI experience actually seems more native to PyCharm than the Jetbrains tools. Highly recommend

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: This AI is a pleasure to work with, although its the same as any other AI. Annoying, not listening, hardheaded and sometimes simply doing what it wants to do without any assignment from me or any confirmation from my side. For example, it happens many times that he asked me to confirm something that he's about to do but doesn't wait for my answer, just replies "ok, lets do it". Once, i asked him to find hard coded text in the code and move it to strings. Quite simple, don't you think? When i was looking how he's changing things, he suddenly starts to change things that has nothing to do with hard coded text or string.xml.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Using it for IntelliJ. Very buggy.

  • Very often the agent doesn't see the terminal output, which is annoying when you work in gradle projects
  • You can't select the text in the chat window... WHY?
  • There is no way to edit your previous message
  • Sometimes it randomly opens a new chat, asking you if you want to keep the current changes
  • Sometimes your messages disappear. Specially annoying when you restart the IDE because of a bug and then your last message is gone, while the agent already changes code. It won't remember it's changes.
